CREATE TABLE AAID( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, package_name TEXT NOT NULL, aaid TEXT NOT NULL );
CREATE TABLE keyword( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, data TEXT DEFAULT NULL, type INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, cloudUid TEXT DEFAULT NULL, sim_id INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 1 );
CREATE TABLE mode( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, name TEXT DEFAULT NULL, state TEXT DEFAULT NULL );
CREATE TABLE OAID( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, oaid TEXT NOT NULL );

CREATE TABLE phone_list( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, number TEXT DEFAULT NULL, display_number TEXT DEFAULT NULL, notes TEXT DEFAULT NULL, state INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, isdisplay INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, type INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 1, cloudUid TEXT DEFAULT NULL, sync_dirty INTEGER DEFAULT 0, e_tag TEXT DEFAULT NULL, record_id TEXT DEFAULT NULL, location INTEGER DEFAULT 0, sim_id INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 1 );
CREATE TABLE reportSms( id TEXT NOT NULL );
CREATE TABLE reportSmsPending( id TEXT NOT NULL, address TEXT, body TEXT, date TEXT );
CREATE TABLE sim( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, sim_id TEXT NOT NULL, call_wait TEXT DEFAULT -1, name TEXT DEFAULT NULL, backsound_mode INTEGER DEFAULT 0 );
CREATE TABLE THIRD_DESKTOP( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, package_name TEXT NOT NULL, application_name TEXT NOT NULL, type INTEGER NOT NULL );
CREATE TABLE VAID( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, package_name TEXT NOT NULL, vaid TEXT NOT NULL );

CREATE TABLE fwlog( _id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, number TEXT DEFAULT NULL, date INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, type INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, reason INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, data1 TEXT DEFAULT NULL, data2 TEXT DEFAULT NULL, read INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, simid TEXT DEFAULT -1, mode INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, callType INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0 );

string.name: ew_guide_start_warning_range
string.Data: Early warnings are provided for the areas covered by the Mainland Earthquake Warning Network of the Chengdu Hi-tech Disaster Reduction Institute. You can find a list of supported coverage areas here.

string.name: ew_guide_statement_text_new
string.Data: "This disclaimer applies to all users (hereinafter referred to as \"you\") who turn on the earthquake warning feature. By agreeing to this disclaimer, you enter into a legally binding contract with Xiaomi Inc. and its affiliates (hereinafter referred to as \"Xiaomi\"). You acknowledge that you have read all the contents of this disclaimer, and you fully understand and agree to all the terms and conditions of this disclaimer; otherwise, you should turn off the earthquake warning feature immediately. In accordance with relevant laws and regulations, Xiaomi will provide you with early warning services based on the scope of the earthquake early warning monitoring area covered by relevant agencies. That is, when you turn on the earthquake warning functionality, you'll be able to receive earthquake warnings issued for specific areas. You can find a list of specific coverage areas here. More coverage areas will be added periodically. This feature provides you with earthquake warning functionality. You must understand that the earthquake warning information is provided by the Chengdu Hi-tech Disaster Reduction Institute. Xiaomi doesn't oversee this organization and doesn't have any control over it. Xiaomi doesn't promise or guarantee the accuracy, validity, and timeliness of earthquake warning information, nor does it guarantee that the earthquake warning service will meet all your needs. Receiving earthquake warning information requires you to keep your device connected to the mobile network. Third party communication line failures, technical problems, network or terminal equipment failures, system instability, and other various force majeure events might prevent you from receiving earthquake warning information. Xiaomi shall not bear any responsibility for any losses caused by such events. You must understand that this feature is provided for your reference only. The warning you receive might come seconds before the onset of an earthquake. You are solely responsible for the risks and consequences of any actions you perform based on the information provided by this feature."

"There may be a problem with the router you're connected to:
"1. Public Wi-Fi network issues" If you're connected to a public Wi-Fi network, the number of users connected to that network may be slowing it down or creating connectivity problems. Switch to another network and try again.
"2. Internet service provider issues" Make sure that your account is in good standing with your Internet service provider.
"3. Router hardware issues" Try rebooting your router or checking the admin settings for your router.
"4. Other router issues" Read the instructions that came with your router and restore your router to its factory settings.
"5. Make sure your router is connected properly" Try using another Ethernet cable to connect your router. If you suspect there's an issue with the connection in your home, contact your Internet service provider."

"There may be a problem with your SIM card:
1. Make sure your account is in good standing with your carrier. Try using a friend's SIM card and see if you're able to connect normally.
2. If you're using two SIM cards, try switching to the other card and see if you're able to connect normally.
3. Make sure your SIM card and your device's SIM slot aren't damaged. Confirm that the SIM card you're using is properly inserted in your device's SIM tray."

This permission allows apps to use the microphone for recording audio.
This permission allows apps to discover and connect to nearby devices, as well as determine their locations.
This permission allows apps to make, answer, and end calls, as well as access your phone number, device status, and mobile network info.
This permission allows apps to send and view SMS and MMS.
This permission allows apps to access your activity info (e.g. step count, workouts).
This permission allows apps to read, search, and clear all your notifications. Remember that notifications may include private information (e.g. bank card numbers and passwords).

This permission allows apps to access the information collected by the built-in sensors that detect your physical activity (e.g. step count and workouts). Remember the information about your physical activity is personal.
This permission allows apps to add voicemail to the system.
This permission allows apps to answer or end calls without your consent.

This permission allows apps to autostart without your confirmation. Giving this permission to multiple apps may slow down your device. Malicious apps use this permission to collect your personal information without you knowing it.
This permission allows apps to display pop-ups without your confirmation. These pop-ups might cover your screen completely affecting normal use.
This permission allows apps to turn Bluetooth on and off without your confirmation.
Apps with this permission can access sensor data about your vital signs (e.g. heart rate)

"This permission allows apps to make unsolicited calls, which may generate additional fees. Note that this permission doesn't allow apps to call emergency phone numbers. Malicious apps might use this permission to make paid calls without your consent."
This permission allows apps to use the camera for taking photos or recording videos.
This permission allows apps to turn Wi-Fi on and off without your confirmation.
This permission allows apps to control your device, which may include clearing data, unlocking the device, and changing passwords. This is a high-risk permission.
This permission allows apps to turn DND mode on and off.

This permission allows apps to display floating windows over any other interface on your device, which may affect the normal use of other apps. Malicious apps might use this permission to read or collect private information (e.g. passwords) through transparent floating windows.
This permission allows apps to access photos, media, and files on your device. Be careful with this permission to avoid unnecessary disclosure of private information.

"If you allow apps to access files in their own folders, the system lets you decide whether you also want these apps to access the items in your Gallery in order to protect your privacy. As the apps with Android API level 29 or higher already support storage partitions, this switch won't be provided for them."

This permission allows apps to access the list of accounts stored on your device. This list might contain all your personal accounts created by installed apps, as well as the accounts from social media platforms and communication tools.
This permission allows apps to create Home screen shortcuts.
This permission allows apps to install other apps on your device. Malicious apps use this permission to install apps without your confirmation.

This permission allows apps to access songs and other audio files stored on this device. These items might contain personal information.
This permission allows apps to access files and documents stored on this device. These items might contain personal information.
This permission allows apps to modify audio settings (e.g. adjust the volume without your confirmation). You might not be able to adjust volume in some apps unless you give them this permission.
This permission allows apps to communicate with NFC cards and devices.
This permission allows apps to provide more personalized and diversified adaptive notifications.
This permission allows apps to create permanent shortcuts in the Notification shade, which may prevent you from seeing regular notifications.

This permission allows apps to track the behavior of other apps on your device and obtain the information which might include your carrier and language settings. This is a high-risk permission. Your device might be monitored, and the security of your personal information may also be at risk.
This permission allows apps to display items on your Home screen or over other apps via picture-in-picture interface.

This permission allows apps to display floating windows over any other interface on your device, which may affect the normal use of other apps. Malicious apps might use this permission to read or collect private information (e.g. passwords) through transparent floating windows.

This permission allows apps to access call history.

string.Data: Security needs to collect necessary personal information to provide you with its services and be able to improve its features.
